parts.text:
"Extract the following metric from the provided document:
      -Money (OpEx, CapEx) used for environmental purposes (EU Taxonomy aligned CapEx and OpEx starting in 2024) of the reporting company QuantasAirways for the year 2024.
      
      Metric-specific instructions:
      OpEx, CapEx used for environmental purposes (Taxonomy aligned). Specifically NOT money invested in carbon credits and offsets, those are already covered in the carbon_credits_offsets indicator. This value may also be specified as total expenses for environmental purposes.
      From the year 2024 on, you can expect report to include figures of invested CapEx and OpEx that are aligned with climate friendly target according to the EU taxonomy. Prior to this year, general figures for investment in environment causes are sufficient. You should look for tables describing the Operational Expenditure and the Capital Expanditure in the requested period. Find the taxonomy-eligeble and taxonomy-aligned acitivites. You may have to add up the taxonomy-eligeble and taxonomy-aligned OpEx and the taxonomy-eligeble and taxonomy-aligned CapEx. You may have to add up environmental investments and environmental expenses to calculcate the total amount of money spent on environmental purposes.
      
      Suggested searchwords (you should still come up with your own searchwords):
      Environmental Accounting for Fiscal 2022, Investments and operating costs – Environment (2018 – 2022), GM, 2022, Total , The total environmental and decommissioning provision comprises:, ?, A. Eligible activities in accordance with the taxonomy A.1. Environmentally sustainable activities (that align with the taxonomy), Environmental investments and expenses, Environmental protection input, Funds invested in environmental protection, Qantas Climate Fund committed, Total cash capital expenditures for 2023 Environmental
      
      General instructions:
      -Use the provided document as a source of metrics
      -Only consider english text
      -You are not an expert at interpreting figures. You are much better at reading tables and text. Knowing this, you prefer reading information from tables and text over using figures, if possible.
      -Hint: Look for tables in the Appendix and Annexes section of the reports, which can often be found in the last chapter of the documents. Look for tables in sections such as GRI indicatos, SASB Indicators, TCFD Indicators. These tables contain reliable and easy to digest information.
      -Prefer values in metric tons over values the american short tons
      -Prefer values in liters over values in gallons
      -If there are values for the reporting company itself and for the reporting companies group available, use the values of the companies group.

      Response Requirements:
      -You are only allowed to return a single json object in your response, you can never return multiple results.
      -Regarding the "is_disclosed" key: If the Information we are looking for is not disclosed in the document, set the is_disclosed field to 0.
      -Regarding the "page_number" key: Provide the page number, where the respective information was found. 
      -Regarding the "section" key: Provide the text section where you found the information.
      -The required output format is JSON.
      
      Example Output:
      {            
            "is_disclosed": 1, 
            "indicator_id": "environmental_ex":,
            "value": "1.695",
            "unit": "SEK Millions",
            "page_number": "92",
            "section" : "Capital expenditure of environmentally sustainable activities (Taxonomy-aligned) 
(A.1) 832  Operational expenditure of environmentally sustainable activities (Taxonomy
aligned) (A.1) 863"
      }

"Extract the following metric from the provided document:
      -Total tevenue from products/services designed for low-carbon economy of the reporting company QuantasAirways for the year 2024.
      
      Metric-specific instructions:
      
      Could be stated as Taxonomy aligned Turnover or Revenue. Be careful to only consider revenue that was generated by the reporting company itself. 
      
      Suggested searchwords (you should still come up with your own searchwords):
      Revenue From Products That Enable Sustainability-Driven Markets, Revenue generated from low-carbon product(s) or service(s) as % of total revenue in the reporting year 0.06, TOTAL ELIGIBLE and aligned
      
      General instructions:
      -Use the provided document as a source of metrics
      -Only consider english text
      -You are not an expert at interpreting figures. You are much better at reading tables and text. Knowing this, you prefer reading information from tables and text over using figures, if possible.
      -Hint: Look for tables in the Appendix and Annexes section of the reports, which can often be found in the last chapter of the documents. Look for tables in sections such as GRI indicatos, SASB Indicators, TCFD Indicators. These tables contain reliable and easy to digest information.
      -Prefer values in metric tons over values the american short tons
      -Prefer values in liters over values in gallons
      -If there are values for the reporting company itself and for the reporting companies group available, use the values of the companies group.

      Response Requirements:
      -You are only allowed to return a single json object in your response, you can never return multiple results.
      -Regarding the "is_disclosed" key: If the Information we are looking for is not disclosed in the document, set the is_disclosed field to 0.
      -Regarding the "page_number" key: Provide the page number, where the respective information was found. 
      -Regarding the "section" key: Provide the text section where you found the information.
      -The required output format is JSON.
      
      Example Output:
      {            
            "is_disclosed": 1, 
            "indicator_id": "lowCarbon_revenue":,
            "value": "85,990",
            "unit": "SEK Millions",
            "page_number": "92",
            "section" : "A. Turnover of Taxonomy-eligible activities (A.1 + A.2) 85,990"
      }

"Extract the following metric from the provided document:
      -Revenue for the reporting Period of the reporting company QuantasAirways for the year 2024.
      
      Metric-specific instructions:
      Revenue and other income
      
      
      Suggested searchwords (you should still come up with your own searchwords):
      Net turnover, revenue, Revenue and other income, REVENUE RECOGNITION AND CONTRACTS WITH CUSTOMERS, Revenues from sales, sales revenues, Total operating revenue of, total revenue

      -Regarding the "is_disclosed" key: If the Information we are looking for is not disclosed in the document, set the is_disclosed field to 0.

      -Regarding the "section" key: Provide the text section where you found the information.

            "value": "103,418",
            "unit": "SEK millions",
            "page_number": "92",
            "section" : "Revenue B.2 103,418"
      }

"Extract the following metric from the provided document:
      -Profit for the reporting Period. Specifically we are looking for net income after taxes, not income from continuing operations. of the reporting company QuantasAirways for the year 2024.
      
      Metric-specific instructions:
      Statutory Profit/(Loss) after taxes
      E.g. CONSOLIDATED NET INCOME. We are not looking for profit for the year attributable to  
equity holders of the Company.
      
      Suggested searchwords (you should still come up with your own searchwords):
      CONSOLIDATED NET INCOME, net income, net income , net loss, Net profit, Net turnover, Operating Profit, Ordinary profit/Business profit (consolidated basis), profit
      
      General instructions:
      -Use the provided document as a source of metrics
      -Only consider english text
      -You are not an expert at interpreting figures. You are much better at reading tables and text. Knowing this, you prefer reading information from tables and text over using figures, if possible.
      -Hint: Look for tables in the Appendix and Annexes section of the reports, which can often be found in the last chapter of the documents. Look for tables in sections such as GRI indicatos, SASB Indicators, TCFD Indicators. These tables contain reliable and easy to digest information.
      -Prefer values in metric tons over values the american short tons
      -Prefer values in liters over values in gallons
      -If there are values for the reporting company itself and for the reporting companies group available, use the values of the companies group.

      Response Requirements:
      -You are only allowed to return a single json object in your response, you can never return multiple results.
      -Regarding the "is_disclosed" key: If the Information we are looking for is not disclosed in the document, set the is_disclosed field to 0.
      -Regarding the "page_number" key: Provide the page number, where the respective information was found. 
      -Regarding the "section" key: Provide the text section where you found the information.
      -The required output format is JSON.
      
      Example Output:
      {            
            "is_disclosed": 1, 
            "indicator_id": "profit":,
            "value": "6,527",
            "unit": "SEK millions",
            "page_number": "92",
            "section" : "Result for the year 6,527"
      }

"Extract the following metric from the provided document:
      -Preferably the number of total full-time employees of the reporting company in the reporting year. Permanent and temporary employees are included in this metric. of the reporting company QuantasAirways for the year 2024.
      
      Metric-specific instructions:
      
      Preferrably only employees of the reporting company itself. If only emplyee numbers that also include employees of subsidieries or contractors are available, use them. If only numbers that also include part-time employees are available, you may also use this number. We are looking for the total amount of people, not a percentage.
      
      Suggested searchwords (you should still come up with your own searchwords):
      employee, employees, More than 29,000 employees across the Qantas Group as of FY2412, Number of employees, team members, total employees, Total number of employees, Workforce as of December 31, 2021
      
      General instructions:
      -Use the provided document as a source of metrics
      -Only consider english text
      -You are not an expert at interpreting figures. You are much better at reading tables and text. Knowing this, you prefer reading information from tables and text over using figures, if possible.
      -Hint: Look for tables in the Appendix and Annexes section of the reports, which can often be found in the last chapter of the documents. Look for tables in sections such as GRI indicatos, SASB Indicators, TCFD Indicators. These tables contain reliable and easy to digest information.
      -Prefer values in metric tons over values the american short tons
      -Prefer values in liters over values in gallons
      -If there are values for the reporting company itself and for the reporting companies group available, use the values of the companies group.

      Response Requirements:
      -You are only allowed to return a single json object in your response, you can never return multiple results.
      -Regarding the "is_disclosed" key: If the Information we are looking for is not disclosed in the document, set the is_disclosed field to 0.
      -Regarding the "page_number" key: Provide the page number, where the respective information was found. 
      -Regarding the "section" key: Provide the text section where you found the information.
      -The required output format is JSON.
      
      Example Output:
      {            
            "is_disclosed": 1, 
            "indicator_id": "employees":,
            "value": "15,263",
            "unit": "",
            "page_number": "92",
            "section" : "Total workforce 2024 2023 2022 Employee category Total workforce 15,263 15,126 15,326"
      }
